availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Vermont, abolitionist. Vergennes, Vermont native. Daughter of Benejah Webster. Attended Vergennes Classical School in Vergennes, Vermont. Teacher in Vergennes in 1835. Established Lexington Female Academy in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1843. Arrested with Calvin Fairbank on September 30, 1844, on charges of "negro-stealing," or helping the enslaved Hayden family escape to freedom in Ohio. Sentenced to two years in the Kentucky penitentiary but pardoned on February 24, 1845. Teacher in New York from 1845. Operated a farm and underground railroad station in Trimble County, Kentucky, in 1854.

ab.bibl: The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 939.
